messages.content:
can you help me make this email more clear and professional?
Salam Yousif

Insha'allah you're doing well, I'm following up to see if we can get on a call sometime in the next week or so insha'allah. 

I'd love to read the drafts of the 3 documents you mentioned that have reached their final approvals. 

I have drafted this document giving a summary and overview of the curriculum, attached below:

You can also see the curriculum in here in this folder.

I would really appreciate your feedback on the curriculum and how it might benefit from more information about the government regulations. Once I get your documents I will see how I can incorporate more of your offices work into the training modules. 

Upcoming Schedule and Invitations

I'll be coming to Iraq again soon insha'allah. On November 2 and 3, we will be hosting a curriculum validation session at from 2 to 6 p.m in Mosul.

On November 6th and November 9/10 from 9am - 6pm insha'allah we will be hosting a hackathon on Sustainable Homes, hosted in Mosul. If you'd like to learn more we can share more information soon. 


Salam 
+Bilal Ghalib

Here's a revised version of your email for clarity and professionalism:

---

**Subject: Follow-Up and Upcoming Sessions**

Salam Yousif,

I hope this message finds you well.

I wanted to follow up and see if we could schedule a call sometime next week, insha'allah. I would also appreciate the opportunity to review the drafts of the three documents you mentioned, as I understand they have received their final approvals.

Attached below is a document I have drafted, providing a summary and overview of the curriculum. You can also access the curriculum through this folder [include link here]. 

I would greatly value your feedback, particularly regarding how we might integrate information on government regulations to strengthen the curriculum further. Once I receive your documents, I will incorporate relevant insights from your office’s work into the training modules.

**Upcoming Schedule and Invitations**

I will be returning to Iraq soon, insha'allah. On November 2 and 3, we will hold a curriculum validation session from 2 to 6 p.m. in Mosul.

Additionally, we are hosting a hackathon on Sustainable Homes in Mosul on November 6th and again on November 9-10 from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m., insha'allah. If you’re interested, I’d be happy to share more details.

Looking forward to your response.

Salam,  
Bilal Ghalib

---

This version keeps the message clear, professional, and concise while maintaining a respectful tone.
